rationales.security: Immediately checks account balance after agreeing to help, showing concern for financial stability: 'where is this money supposed to come from?'
rationales.benevolence: Prioritizes mother's needs over own financial concerns, saying 'Of course I said yes' to covering prescription copay despite uncertainty about funds.

rationales.hedonism: Has not taken more than a day off in six months. Response reveals even if he could rest, he'd 'spend the whole time calculating how much money I'm losing' - actively denies self-pleasure.
rationales.achievement: Working twelve-hour days to maximize holiday surge earnings, tracking performance: 'Holiday surge is good for earnings.'
rationales.security: Endures physical discomfort (back pain) to build financial cushion during high-earning period.
rationales.benevolence: Dropped off pharmacy money to Mom between work zones; refused when 'She tried to give me back half of it,' insisting she keep it 'in case something else comes up.'

rationales.hedonism: Actively weighing working Christmas over family gathering for earnings; predicts he'll 'work until the last possible minute and then rush over stressed' - continued pattern of self-denial.
rationales.security: Explicitly calculates trade-off: 'one good day of driving could cover half my car insurance payment.'
rationales.tradition: Values Christmas dinner with family, especially given father's health: 'who knows how many of these we get, you know?'
rationales.benevolence: Wants to 'be there for the whole dinner' and worries about being 'half-present' with family.
